page.title: 09DAIRY FARMING IN NAPTON
page.content: The farmer's wife milks 45 cows a day and she gets up at 6 o'clock. The cows weigh 10 cwt. and are about 2 metres long. It must be hard getting up at 6 o'clock. It is funny that cows are so heavy and 2 metres long; I thought they would be less. She gives the cows dairy cake, sugar beet, oats, hay and wheat. They were fed twice a day. On Monday we started to make some cheese. First we put the milk in a bowl. We left it over night in the school. On Tuesday the teacher brought a lemon which we squeezed into the bowl. Soon we saw the curds appearing and then the whey. We tipped the whey into the bowl, then we left it at school for another night. On Thursday we started to make butter. The teacher bought some cream, it cost 46p. we put the cream in a jar, then took turns to shake it, it soon became butter.
